poll_list.title: Whitelist Oasis.app on Multiple Oracles (MIP10c9-SP30) - April 18, 2022

discourse_list.title: MIP10c9-SP30: Proposal to whitelist Oasis.app on ETHUSD, WSTETHUSD, WBTCUSD, RENBTCUSD YFIUSD, UNIUSD, LINKUSD, MANAUSD

content.content: MIP10c9-SP30: Subproposal to Whitelist Oracle Access to Oasis.app on ETHUSD, WSTETHUSD, BTCUSD, YFIUSD, UNIUSD, LINKUSD, MANAUSD  Preamble MIP10c9-SP#: 30 Author(s): Chris Bradbury Contributors: Chris Bradbury, Adam Skrodzki Type: Process Component Tags: oracles Status: Formal Submission Date Proposed: 2022-04-01 Date Ratified: <yyyy-mm-dd>   Specification  Introduction Oasis.app, a third-party application for accessing the Maker Protocol and wider DeFi ecosystem, is planning to launch a set of new automation features to allow for better management and protection of Maker Vaults going forward. In order for the automation features to be trustless and verifiable on-chain, Oasis.app is requesting whitelist access to the following OSMs listed below to allow its automation smart contracts to read the current and next price of the relevant Oracles.  Oracle Names  ETH/USD WSTETH/USD WBTC/USD RENBTC/USD YFI/USD UNI/USD LINK/USD MANA/USD   Customer(s) Oasis.app - [email protected]  Whitelist Oasis.app - 0x55Dc2Be8020bCa72E58e665dC931E03B749ea5E0 - OSM   Requirements For each customer address to be whitelisted: - Is the contract source code verified on Etherscan? yes - Is the Oracle data used in a permissioned manner that would prevent parasitic behavior? yes - Is Oracle data written to storage? no - If Oracle data is stored, is it stored in a private variable? n/a - If Oracle data is stored, is the value accessible on-chain exclusively by the protocol? n/a  Fee In accordance with the Responsible Oracle Migration Proposal, fees are waived for the first year and determined by MKR Governance after that.  Changelog 8-Apr-2022 - Split BTC/USD Oracle into both WBTC and RENBTC for clarity

Hey @ChrisB Assuming this passes - how long would you need notice if governance decides to offboard some collateral and shut down the corresponding oracles? Both MANA and UNI habe been candidates for offboarding already

I don’t think we’d need anything different or specific related to this. As always with offboarding, the longer the users have to discover the news and take action the better. Is Uni and Mana in the process of being offboarded currently? Or just that it was previously close to being offboarded?
Wanted to make sure @Oracles-Core-Unit saw this post

Hey @prose11 @GovAlpha-Core-Unit Please could this go into today’s polling? I’m aware that there is no Oracle Review posted yet, but that should be here very soon based on comments last Friday in the Oracles Channel on Discord. Thanks

Hey @ChrisB, Sorry at this point with no verification posted it will have to sit out this week’s polling. As stated in MIP10c2: Process for Oracle Onboarding Request, the proposal remains in limbo until the @Oracles-Core-Unit commits to the onboarding work load. Ideally this work will be committed to and the Onboarding Template filled out before this Friday so it can enter in next week’s polls.
Ahhh ok, not a problem. We’ll wait for that to be filled out then  Thanks @prose11

We need to remove this pointless whitelist asap. Provides zero benefit while creating the worst dev experience ever by forcing builders to interact with maker governance just to build on the protocol.

The OCU has finished reviewing the contract and determined the OSM queued price is only used in a permissioned manner. All other prices are pulled from the permissionless Spotter. Polling Vote will go up next Monday, for inclusion in the following weeks Executive Vote.

Having permission-less whitelisting is already in the works for the new Oracle contract we’re working on. However the whitelist itself is still extremely useful for legibility to identify users and usecases.
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
